item.title: EU says it will continue rolling out AI legislation on schedule
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: The European Union said it will stick to its timeline for rolling out its AI legislation, ignoring calls by tech companies to delay the bloc's AI rules.

item.title: Slate Auto drops ‘under $20,000’ pricing after Trump administration ends federal EV tax credit
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Slate Auto has updated its website after Congress passed President Trump's tax cut bill, which will eliminate the federal EV tax credit.

item.title: Everyone in tech has an opinion about Soham Parekh
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: There is now a new badge of honor for startup founders: your proximity to one previously unknown Indian software engineer named Soham Parekh.

item.title: Cluely’s ARR doubled in a week to $7M, founder Roy Lee says. But rivals are coming.
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Cluely's rapid ascend may be challenged by free copycat products.

item.title: Who is Soham Parekh, the serial moonlighter Silicon Valley startups can’t stop hiring?
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Stories about Soham Parekh, a software engineer that simultaneously works at several startups, have gone viral in the last week. Who is he?

item.title: TechCrunch All Stage brings back early launch prices for a limited time
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Ticket rates have officially rolled back with savings of up to $425, as TechCrunch All Stage becomes startup central July 15 in Boston.

item.title: Wonder Dynamics co-founder Nikola Todorovic joins the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Nikola Todorovic, co-founder of Wonder Dynamics, joins the AI Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 in San Francisco from October 27-29. Register to join.

item.title: Stripe’s first employee, the founder of fintech Increase, sort of bought a bank
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Competitors to Darragh Buckley's Increase are so nervous about his ambitions to "own" a bank, someone has been trying to stop him.

item.title: Final GOP bill kneecaps renewables and hydrogen but lifts nuclear and geothermal
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: The final bill is largely what emerged from the Senate Finance Committee in mid-June.

item.title: Not everyone is thrilled with Threads’ DMs
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The company is now facing user backlash over the addition, as users, primarily women, are arguing that there should be a way to opt out of DMs entirely, citing harassment concerns.

item.title: Ilya Sutskever will lead Safe Superintelligence following his CEO’s exit
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever says he stepping into the CEO role at Safe Superintelligence, the AI startup he launched in 2024.

item.title: Kristen Craft brings fresh fundraising strategy to the Foundation Stage at TechCrunch All Stage
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: At TechCrunch All Stage on July 15 at Boston’s SoWa Power Station, Kristen Craft, Head of Business Development at Fidelity Private Shares, will lead a roundtable session titled “It’s Not 2021 Anymore. Navigating the 2025 VC Landscape.”

item.title: Y Combinator alum launched a new $34M fund dedicated to YC startups, backed by Garry Tan
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Kulveer Taggar, a two-time YC alum and founder of Zeus Living, founded Phosphor Capital last year

item.title: Trump admin unlawfully killed health websites related to gender, court rules
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: On the first day of his term, President Trump passed a deluge of executive orders, including one that ordered government agencies to change the language of government materials that address "gender ideology." This is the administration's way of referring to transgender or non-binary people.

item.title: Meta has found another way to keep you engaged: Chatbots that message you first
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Meta is experimenting with having customizable chatbots messaging users unprompted and follow up on past conversations.

item.title: Pinwheel introduces a smartwatch for kids that includes an AI chatbot
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description: The Pinwheel Watch is designed specifically for kids aged 7 to 14, offering parental management tools, GPS tracking, texting, and more.

item.title: Castelion is raising a $350M Series B to scale hypersonic missile business
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: A hypersonics weapon startup is lining up a massive new funding round to scale its business with the U.S Department of Defense.

item.title: xAI gets permits for 15 natural gas generators at Memphis data center
item.dc:creator: Tim De Chant
item.description: Elon Musk's AI company has been operating more than twice that number without permits for months, a legal group alleges.

item.title: Ransomware gang Hunters International says it’s shutting down
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description: The cybercriminal group, which said it's releasing its decryption tools to victims, may be transitioning to new infrastructure under a different name.

item.title: Tighten up your cap table with Fidelity, Cimulate, and DepositLink at TechCrunch All Stage 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Fundraising is already hard — don’t let a messy cap table make it harder. At TechCrunch All Stage on July 15, founders will get a behind-the-scenes look at what it really takes to keep a raise on track during the roundtable session “Preparing to Raise: Cap Table Best Practices to Help You Close Fast.” Hosted […]
